definition: dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
danger/dangerous/rugged
elephant/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/shape/form/appearance/to imitate
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
surname Huan
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: But 2009 will be a dangerous year.
sentences.chinese: 但是，2009年将是险象环生的一年。

sentences.english: He drove like a maniac. We had one near miss after another.
sentences.chinese: 他开车像个疯子，我们一路上险象环生。

sentences.english: To rescue old housekeeper and the return of the crisis to return to France alone.
sentences.chinese: 为了搭救老管家而只身回到险象环生的法国。

sentences.english: The company was "in constant danger, " Swisher writes.
sentences.chinese: 公司那时正“险象环生”，斯威瑟写道。

danger lurks on every side (idiom)
to be in straitened circumstances
critical circumstances/risky conditions/danger zone
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless

hard fighting/fierce battle
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless

to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
